we.0: The Zoological Society of San Diego D/B/A San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance (“Our”, “Us” or “We”), operates sandiegozoo.org, sdzsafaripark.org, sandiegozoowildlifealliance.org, sdzwa.org, zoomember.com, sandiegozookids.org, animals.sandiegozoo.org, events.sandiegozoo.org, zoofoodandwine.com, sdzglobalacademy.org, science.sandiegozoo.org, kids.sandiegozoo.org, travel.sandiegozoo.org, stories.sandiegozoo.org, weddings.sandiegozoo.org, shopzoo.com, library.sandiegozoo.org, repository.sandiegozoo.org, ielc.libguides.com/sdzg/, and sandiegozoo100.org (the “Websites”) and recognizes the importance of protecting the privacy of the users of these Websites. Except when express permission is specifically and knowingly provided by you, the website user (“User”, “You” or “Your”), San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance collects no personally identifying information about individuals. The name, address, and payment information (if applicable) that a User might provide when using these Websites may be processed or disclosed by San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance as permitted under the Websites’ respective Terms of Use, which a User agrees to upon utilizing the information and services of the Websites.  It is necessary to gather certain information from You in order to provide an efficient and pleasant shopping experience. By using a number of security technologies in our Websites, We maintain, as a priority, the privacy of your information. We also adhere to strict policies in attempting to prevent the unauthorized use of your personal information. Finally, please note that this policy applies only to Our Websites and not to our sponsors’ or third-party partners’ websites to which We link.

we.1: We utilize cookies, which are small pieces of information sent to your web browser by a website that you visit. Used as a method of tracking, cookies also enable San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance to relate a visitor’s use of San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance information to any information that a visitor may have specifically and knowingly provided to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance. Any such voluntarily provided information, if applicable, may be used by San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance for editorial, marketing, or promotional purposes. You can set your browser to not accept cookies from Our Websites or other websites you may visit. By doing so, however, some websites or portions of websites may not function properly. By using Our Websites and not disabling cookies, You consent to allowing their use for the purposes described in this policy.

we.2: In addition to cookies, information We collect from You is used to help us monitor site usage and traffic patterns of Our customers to the extent that it serves Our business purposes. San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance will maintain safeguards to ensure the security, integrity, and privacy of Your information.  Statistical aggregate information, as well as personal information, is collected for internal and administrative purposes. Any public disclosure of aggregate information regarding site usage and traffic, which is necessary for business marketing and advertising purposes, is always devoid of any personally identifying information.

we.3: The personally identifiable information that You provide to Us and information about any order that you place on our Websites may be combined with other of Your personally identifiable information from Our records and other sources. This information will be used to make Our future marketing efforts to You more efficient. This information may also be shared with our carefully selected third-party service providers and other marketers whose products or services We feel may be of interest to You. Once We share your information with a third-party, such information becomes subject to such third-party’s privacy practices.

we.4: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance is concerned about protecting children’s privacy. If You are under the age of 13, We do not want your personal information. Please do not submit any personal information to Us. We encourage parents to actively protect their children’s privacy by instructing them never to provide personal information to any individual or organization without parental permission. San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance will never knowingly request personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 13 without prior verifiable parental consent. If we become aware that a child under 13 years of age has provided us with such information without consent, we will take appropriate action to remove such information from our files. If a parent or guardian becomes aware that a child under 13 years of age has provided such information to us, he or she should contact us at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Donor Privacy Policy, P.O. Box 120271, San Diego, CA 92112. There may be some areas within Our Websites where people may post messages or provide feedback, but those under the age of 13 children are again discouraged from providing any personal information. If a visitor known to be a child (younger than 13) sends an e-mail to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, We will only use it to respond to the e-mail and not to create profiles or otherwise retain the information.

we.5: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance has incorporated the latest Internet technological standards into the design of the secure purchase areas of its Websites. We also monitor network traffic to identify unauthorized attempts to access, upload, or change information on the Websites and across Our network. Under no uncertain terms, any information You send us while within the secure shipping area is protected by 128-bit “Secure Socket Layer” SSL encryption, making Your transaction safe and reliable. You can tell whether you are in our secure shopping area by viewing the “lock” or “key” at the bottom of your browser—an unlocked or broken key (depending on your browser) means you are in an unsecured area.

we.6: As a standard Internet practice, should your credit card company hold you liable for some portion of a fraudulent charge stemming from Our Website(s), We will reimburse You for the maximum liability of $50, provided the purchase was made through Our secure server.

we.7: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance requires the use of Your name, e-mail address, shipping address, and credit card number/expiration date in order to process and fulfill Your order. We might also request additional information that you choose to submit about your interests or feedback about our Website(s) and products so that We can provide a better shopping experience for You. The name, address, and payment information that a User might provide when using Our Websites may be processed or disclosed by San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance as permitted under such Website’s Terms of Use, to which the User agrees to upon utilizing the information and services of the Websites.

we.8: The Zoological Society of San Diego D/B/A San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance (“Our” “We”, or “Us”) is committed to respecting the privacy of Our donors and members. This Donor Privacy Policy (“Donor Policy”) outlines how San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance collects, uses and protects donor information and exists in conjunction with San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance's internet privacy policy found at sdzwa.org.

we.9: This Donor Policy covers donor information we collect through the mail, over the phone, on site at our facilities, off site at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance events and online through our Websites and was created to provide confidence as you donate, visit, join, or use our services. It also demonstrates our commitment to fair information practices and the protection of privacy.

we.10: With respect to our donation and membership fundraising practices, we abide by The Association of Fundraising Professional’s (AFP) Donor Bill of Rights, which requires that we handle all information about our donors and members with respect and with confidentiality to the full extent provided by law.

we.11: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance will collect donor and member information when processing monetary or in-kind donations, establishing San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance membership, completing online purchases, registering for San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance programs or events and when providing customer or donor stewardship services. We may use your information to send you transactional receipts, renewal notices, upgrade offers, park updates and newsletters, as well as occasional mailings and emails about San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance and its programs that We think might be of interest to you.

we.12: You consent to this Donor Privacy Policy when making a donation to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, purchasing San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance membership products or services, visiting our facilities, conducting donor transactions through the mail, on site or through our Call Center or by accessing Our Websites. We reserve the right to revise this Donor Privacy Policy at any time.  Please visit sdzwa.org for the most current version of our Donor Privacy Policy or write to us at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Donor Privacy Policy, P.O. Box 120271, San Diego, CA 92112.

other.2: Shopping on the Internet is safe, and online credit card transactions are no more risky than other means of shopping. Our encryption methods make credit card fraud even more difficult than mail or phone orders, or even in-person purchases. If You experience fraudulent use of your credit card as a result of using Our Websites, notify your credit card company per its rules and procedures. Most credit card companies will either cover the fraudulent purchases or hold you liable for no more than $50.

policy.7: The Zoological Society of San Diego D/B/A San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance (“Our” “We”, or “Us”) is committed to respecting the privacy of Our donors and members. This Donor Privacy Policy (“Donor Policy”) outlines how San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance collects, uses and protects donor information and exists in conjunction with San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance's internet privacy policy found at sdzwa.org.

policy.8: This Donor Policy covers donor information we collect through the mail, over the phone, on site at our facilities, off site at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance events and online through our Websites and was created to provide confidence as you donate, visit, join, or use our services. It also demonstrates our commitment to fair information practices and the protection of privacy.

policy.9: You consent to this Donor Privacy Policy when making a donation to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, purchasing San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance membership products or services, visiting our facilities, conducting donor transactions through the mail, on site or through our Call Center or by accessing Our Websites. We reserve the right to revise this Donor Privacy Policy at any time.  Please visit sdzwa.org for the most current version of our Donor Privacy Policy or write to us at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Donor Privacy Policy, P.O. Box 120271, San Diego, CA 92112.

children.1: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance is concerned about protecting children’s privacy. If You are under the age of 13, We do not want your personal information. Please do not submit any personal information to Us. We encourage parents to actively protect their children’s privacy by instructing them never to provide personal information to any individual or organization without parental permission. San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance will never knowingly request personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 13 without prior verifiable parental consent. If we become aware that a child under 13 years of age has provided us with such information without consent, we will take appropriate action to remove such information from our files. If a parent or guardian becomes aware that a child under 13 years of age has provided such information to us, he or she should contact us at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Donor Privacy Policy, P.O. Box 120271, San Diego, CA 92112. There may be some areas within Our Websites where people may post messages or provide feedback, but those under the age of 13 children are again discouraged from providing any personal information. If a visitor known to be a child (younger than 13) sends an e-mail to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, We will only use it to respond to the e-mail and not to create profiles or otherwise retain the information.

consent.0: We utilize cookies, which are small pieces of information sent to your web browser by a website that you visit. Used as a method of tracking, cookies also enable San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance to relate a visitor’s use of San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance information to any information that a visitor may have specifically and knowingly provided to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance. Any such voluntarily provided information, if applicable, may be used by San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance for editorial, marketing, or promotional purposes. You can set your browser to not accept cookies from Our Websites or other websites you may visit. By doing so, however, some websites or portions of websites may not function properly. By using Our Websites and not disabling cookies, You consent to allowing their use for the purposes described in this policy.

consent.1: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance is concerned about protecting children’s privacy. If You are under the age of 13, We do not want your personal information. Please do not submit any personal information to Us. We encourage parents to actively protect their children’s privacy by instructing them never to provide personal information to any individual or organization without parental permission. San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance will never knowingly request personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 13 without prior verifiable parental consent. If we become aware that a child under 13 years of age has provided us with such information without consent, we will take appropriate action to remove such information from our files. If a parent or guardian becomes aware that a child under 13 years of age has provided such information to us, he or she should contact us at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Donor Privacy Policy, P.O. Box 120271, San Diego, CA 92112. There may be some areas within Our Websites where people may post messages or provide feedback, but those under the age of 13 children are again discouraged from providing any personal information. If a visitor known to be a child (younger than 13) sends an e-mail to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, We will only use it to respond to the e-mail and not to create profiles or otherwise retain the information.

consent.2: YOUR CONSENT AND CHANGES TO POLICY

consent.4: Consent and Changes To Our Donor Privacy Policy

consent.5: You consent to this Donor Privacy Policy when making a donation to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, purchasing San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance membership products or services, visiting our facilities, conducting donor transactions through the mail, on site or through our Call Center or by accessing Our Websites. We reserve the right to revise this Donor Privacy Policy at any time.  Please visit sdzwa.org for the most current version of our Donor Privacy Policy or write to us at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Donor Privacy Policy, P.O. you consent.0: We utilize cookies, which are small pieces of information sent to your web browser by a website that you visit. Used as a method of tracking, cookies also enable San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance to relate a visitor’s use of San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance information to any information that a visitor may have specifically and knowingly provided to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance. Any such voluntarily provided information, if applicable, may be used by San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance for editorial, marketing, or promotional purposes. you consent.1: By using our Website(s), You consent to this Privacy Policy and the Terms of Use.  This Privacy Policy may be changed at any time. Please check this page periodically for any changes. Your continued use of Our Website(s) following the posting of any changes constitutes Your acceptance of the changes.

you consent.2: You consent to this Donor Privacy Policy when making a donation to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, purchasing San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance membership products or services, visiting our facilities, conducting donor transactions through the mail, on site or through our Call Center or by accessing Our Websites. We reserve the right to revise this Donor Privacy Policy at any time.  Please visit sdzwa.org for the most current version of our Donor Privacy Policy or write to us at San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Donor Privacy Policy, P.O. Box 120271, San Diego, CA 92112.

you choose.0: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance requires the use of Your name, e-mail address, shipping address, and credit card number/expiration date in order to process and fulfill Your order. We might also request additional information that you choose to submit about your interests or feedback about our Website(s) and products so that We can provide a better shopping experience for You. The name, address, and payment information that a User might provide when using Our Websites may be processed or disclosed by San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance as permitted under such Website’s Terms of Use, to which the User agrees to upon utilizing the information and services of the Websites.

third-party.0: The Zoological Society of San Diego D/B/A San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance (“Our”, “Us” or “We”), operates sandiegozoo.org, sdzsafaripark.org, sandiegozoowildlifealliance.org, sdzwa.org, zoomember.com, sandiegozookids.org, animals.sandiegozoo.org, events.sandiegozoo.org, zoofoodandwine.com, sdzglobalacademy.org, science.sandiegozoo.org, kids.sandiegozoo.org, travel.sandiegozoo.org, stories.sandiegozoo.org, weddings.sandiegozoo.org, shopzoo.com, library.sandiegozoo.org, repository.sandiegozoo.org, ielc.libguides.com/sdzg/, and sandiegozoo100.org (the “Websites”) and recognizes the importance of protecting the privacy of the users of these Websites. Except when express permission is specifically and knowingly provided by you, the website user (“User”, “You” or “Your”), San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance collects no personally identifying information about individuals. The name, address, and payment information (if applicable) that a User might provide when using these Websites may be processed or disclosed by San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance as permitted under the Websites’ respective Terms of Use, which a User agrees to upon utilizing the information and services of the Websites.  It is necessary to gather certain information from You in order to provide an efficient and pleasant shopping experience. By using a number of security technologies in our Websites, We maintain, as a priority, the privacy of your information. We also adhere to strict policies in attempting to prevent the unauthorized use of your personal information. Finally, please note that this policy applies only to Our Websites and not to our sponsors’ or third-party partners’ websites to which We link.

third-party.1: The personally identifiable information that You provide to Us and information about any order that you place on our Websites may be combined with other of Your personally identifiable information from Our records and other sources. This information will be used to make Our future marketing efforts to You more efficient. This information may also be shared with our carefully selected third-party service providers and other marketers whose products or services We feel may be of interest to You. Once We share your information with a third-party, such information becomes subject to such third-party’s privacy practices.

third-party.2: The use of cookies and basic information can be used for the targeting and retargeting of messages across various websites for internet-based advertising. This includes sharing cookie data and basic information with third-party advertising vendors for the optimization of marketing campaigns. Examples of information which may be automatically collected include type of operating system, type of browser, the User’s IP address, the User’s website visits before and after coming to Our Websites, UDID (mobile devices), links clicked, and standard server log information.

third-party.3: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance may share donor and member information with Our third-party service providers to help us steward, retain and expand our donor and membership base. These services may include membership marketing and fulfillment, membership processing and data analytics.

third-party.4: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance provides you with the opportunity to exercise an opt-out choice if you do not want to receive donor communications from Us, direct mail offers, telemarketing offers, emails or updates, or if you do not want Us to share your personally identifiable information with our third-party service providers. To opt out, please write to San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance, Attention: Opt Out, P.O. Box 120271, San Diego, CA. 92112. This will prevent the sharing of your donor information and will cease all communications not required by law.

may share.0: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance may share donor and member information with Our third-party service providers to help us steward, retain and expand our donor and membership base. These services may include membership marketing and fulfillment, membership processing and data analytics.

we share.0: The personally identifiable information that You provide to Us and information about any order that you place on our Websites may be combined with other of Your personally identifiable information from Our records and other sources. This information will be used to make Our future marketing efforts to You more efficient. This information may also be shared with our carefully selected third-party service providers and other marketers whose products or services We feel may be of interest to You. Once We share your information with a third-party, such information becomes subject to such third-party’s privacy practices.

business purposes.0: In addition to cookies, information We collect from You is used to help us monitor site usage and traffic patterns of Our customers to the extent that it serves Our business purposes. San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance will maintain safeguards to ensure the security, integrity, and privacy of Your information.  Statistical aggregate information, as well as personal information, is collected for internal and administrative purposes. Any public disclosure of aggregate information regarding site usage and traffic, which is necessary for business marketing and advertising purposes, is always devoid of any personally identifying information.

business purposes.1: The personally identifiable information that you provide to us, along with donor transactional information may be combined with other personally identifiable information and transaction information from our records and other sources to help us carry out Our legitimate business purposes.

information you.0: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance has incorporated the latest Internet technological standards into the design of the secure purchase areas of its Websites. We also monitor network traffic to identify unauthorized attempts to access, upload, or change information on the Websites and across Our network. Under no uncertain terms, any information You send us while within the secure shipping area is protected by 128-bit “Secure Socket Layer” SSL encryption, making Your transaction safe and reliable. You can tell whether you are in our secure shopping area by viewing the “lock” or “key” at the bottom of your browser—an unlocked or broken key (depending on your browser) means you are in an unsecured area.

usage.0: In addition to cookies, information We collect from You is used to help us monitor site usage and traffic patterns of Our customers to the extent that it serves Our business purposes. San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance will maintain safeguards to ensure the security, integrity, and privacy of Your information.  Statistical aggregate information, as well as personal information, is collected for internal and administrative purposes. Any public disclosure of aggregate information regarding site usage and traffic, which is necessary for business marketing and advertising purposes, is always devoid of any personally identifying information.

analytics.0: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance may share donor and member information with Our third-party service providers to help us steward, retain and expand our donor and membership base. These services may include membership marketing and fulfillment, membership processing and data analytics.

fraud.0: Shopping on the Internet is safe, and online credit card transactions are no more risky than other means of shopping. Our encryption methods make credit card fraud even more difficult than mail or phone orders, or even in-person purchases. If You experience fraudulent use of your credit card as a result of using Our Websites, notify your credit card company per its rules and procedures. Most credit card companies will either cover the fraudulent purchases or hold you liable for no more than $50.

encryption.0: San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance has incorporated the latest Internet technological standards into the design of the secure purchase areas of its Websites. We also monitor network traffic to identify unauthorized attempts to access, upload, or change information on the Websites and across Our network. Under no uncertain terms, any information You send us while within the secure shipping area is protected by 128-bit “Secure Socket Layer” SSL encryption, making Your transaction safe and reliable. You can tell whether you are in our secure shopping area by viewing the “lock” or “key” at the bottom of your browser—an unlocked or broken key (depending on your browser) means you are in an unsecured area.

encryption.1: Shopping on the Internet is safe, and online credit card transactions are no more risky than other means of shopping. Our encryption methods make credit card fraud even more difficult than mail or phone orders, or even in-person purchases. If You experience fraudulent use of your credit card as a result of using Our Websites, notify your credit card company per its rules and procedures. Most credit card companies will either cover the fraudulent purchases or hold you liable for no more than $50.
